critique: This document is an executive order that transfers land between three national forests. It does not seem to have any ideological tilt, immigration implications, or implications for civil liberties. It does not expand executive power, as it is authorized by an act of Congress. It does not seem to have any implications for economic regulation or social inclusion. It does shift control of land from two national forests to another, which could be seen as a slight shift towards federal control, but it is minimal.
